pageContext.claim: “A single immigrant can begin a chain that could ultimately bring in dozens of increasingly distant relations.”
pageContext.analysis: This is an exaggeration. In September 2017, the Center for Immigration Studies, a right-leaning research organization, released a one pager on chain migration. The report found that "according to the most complete contemporary academic studies on chain migration, in recent years each new immigrant sponsored an average of 3.45 additional immigrants. In the early 1980s, the chain migration multiplier was 2.59, or more than 30 percent lower." In most cases the sponsored family members were spouses and parents -- not distant relatives.
